Reason: The 'enablePngCrush' configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly affects the system performance at the system level. Enabling PngCrush adds the PngCrush postprocessor to the list of postprocessors that will be applied to processed files, which can significantly impact the execution time and memory consumption during the conversion process. The code snippet related to the 'enablePngCrush' configuration shows that if the option is set to true, the PngCrush postprocessor is added, leading to additional processing and potential performance variations at the system level.
